# MTLVertexAttributeDescriptorArray

**Class**

An array of vertex attribute descriptor instances.

## Declaration

```swift
class MTLVertexAttributeDescriptorArray
```

## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLVertexAttributeDescriptorArray] instance is an array of instances that defines how vertex attribute data is formatted and assigned to an index in the attribute argument table. The methods of [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLVertexAttributeDescriptorArray] set or retrieve the attribute formatting information from the array.

## Accessing a specified vertex attribute

- **subscript(_:)**: Returns the state of the specified vertex attribute.

## Render pass inputs

- **MTLVertexDescriptor**: An instance that describes how to organize and map data to a vertex function.
- **MTLVertexAttributeDescriptor**: An object that determines how to store attribute data in memory and map it to the arguments of a vertex function.
- **MTLVertexBufferLayoutDescriptor**: An object that configures how a render pipeline fetches data to send to the vertex function.
- **MTLVertexBufferLayoutDescriptorArray**: An array of vertex buffer layout descriptor instances.
- **MTLBufferLayoutStrideDynamic**
